alert.note: Alert for Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 03 at 2:19PM CDT until April 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED TUESDAY AFTERNOON... .Very dry and windy conditions will develop across parts of northeast Oklahoma Tuesday afternoon as a dry line moves into the area. The most dangerous conditions are expected to remain to the west of U.S. Highway 75, where several wildfires have occurred recently and may still be ongoing at that time. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR PARTS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Washington, and Tulsa counties. * WIND...Southwest 20 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 45 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity 20 to 35 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Max temperatures low to mid 80s. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur.
